definition: to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly

sentences.english: The crust on the snow was thick enough for us to walk on it.
sentences.chinese: 外層的雪已經凍硬，可以在上面行走。

sentences.english: The clothes on the washing-line were frozen stiff and I couldn't fold them into the basket.
sentences.chinese: 晾衣繩上的衣服凍硬了，我無法將它們塞進籃子裏。

sentences.english: Freeze it only until firm but not rock solid.
sentences.chinese: 把它凍硬，但是不要硬得像石頭一樣。

sentences.english: It was bitterly cold now and the ground was frozen hard.
sentences.chinese: 現在天氣冷極了，地面都凍硬了。

sentences.english: Between the outside and inside walls of the bowl there is some jelly, which freezes hard when cooled.
sentences.chinese: 在碗的內外壁之間有一些果凍，冷卻時會凍硬。
